div.p: The PHP development team would like to announce the 2nd release candidate of PHP 5.4.1. Windows binaries can be downloaded from the Windows QA site.

p.strong: THIS IS A RELEASE CANDIDATE - DO NOT USE IT IN PRODUCTION!

div.p: This is the 2nd release candidate. The release candidate phase is intended as a period of bug fixing prior to the stable release. The release candidate fixes a critical issue when using the internal classes in multiple threads.
A complete list of changes since the last release candidate can be found in the NEWS file.

Please help us to identify bugs in order to ensure that the release is solid and all things behave as expected by taking the time to test this release candidate against your code base and reporting any problems that you encounter to the QA mailing list and/or the PHP bug tracker.
PHP 5.4.1 final will be released on April 26.
